After 13 years in broadcasting, I started this company and oversee all of our operations. I also provide voice over and on camera talent services for our clients.

I was originally hired to be the stations Sports Director and then was promoted to Main News Anchor. In addition to my anchoring responsibilities, I produced numerous half hour television programs for the sports department and covered a Republican National convention for the news department.
I served as the weekend sports anchor and weekday sports reporter.
Worked in the sports department as a free lance reporter.
I served as the stations Sports Director. Also covered Hurricane Hugo for the station after it ripped through Charleston, SC.
ATO Fraternity, KTXT-FM disc jockey, news anchor and sportscaster.

Majored in communications and was a disc jockey, news and sports reporter at KTXT-FM. I later became sports director at the station before turning my attention to broadcast television and after serving an internship at KCBD-TV, I was hired full time at the beginning of my senior year. I started as a sports reporter and anchor before being promoted to the noon and five news anchor at the NBC affiliate.

Bill draws on his vast experience and background in the television news and production business in his current capacity. He is extremely detail oriented, yet knows how to complete a project in a timely manner thus minimizing your financial exposure. Bill keeps you in the loop during the project at all junctures and is very easy and pleasant to work with. He values your opinion but is not afraid to interject his own expertise if the opinion does not further the project or add anything to the final outcome. That honesty is refreshing and welcome.

summary: After spending more than a decade as an award-winning television anchor and reporter at network affiliates around the country, including my last stop at KPHO-TV here in Phoenix, I decided in 1997 to start Baerclaw Productions, a full-service video production company in Phoenix, Arizona. The thing that I loved the most about working in television was the opportunity to share the amazing stories that are all around us. The passion to find creative ways to share these stories has only been strengthened since going out on my own, and it's what gets me up in the morning.While I still fill in at Channel 5 and Channel 3 here in Phoenix, helping my clients share their stories with the world is what makes me the happiest.Over the years, I have been the executive producer on projects for companies of all sizes from small startups to Fortune 500 companies. I have the opportunity to lead a great team made up of highly talented and driven professionals who have more than 100 years of combined video production and television experience.I have worked on every type of video project including corporate videos, web videos, promotional videos, sales and training videos, commercials, public service announcements, video news releases, television programs, infomercials and documentaries.My skillset includes research and planning, script writing, field production and all post production services included editing. I also provide voiceover and on-camera talent services as needed.Since starting my broadcasting career in 1984, there isn't much that I haven't seen, which is why I want to be your resource for ALL things video. If you'd like to see some of my work, please visit the Baerclaw Productions YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/BaerclawProductions/videos.You can learn more about my company by visiting http://www.baerclawproductions.com/.
name: Bill Baer, Video Production Expert
title: Owner / Executive Producer at Baerclaw Video Productions
